turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Olepa ocellifera.
turn.1: What do you know about Olepa ocellifera?
turn.2: Olepa ocellifera Olepa ocellifera is a moth of the family Erebidae first described by Francis Walker in 1855.
turn.4: It is found in India and Sri Lanka.
turn.5: What else is interesting about it?
turn.6: Ths species closely resembles the much more widely distributed "Olepa ricini", and differs only in the presence of a chain-like series of small yellow-banded black spots in between the large spots on the forewings, which are lacking in "O. ricini".
turn.7: What other colors does it have?
turn.8: Head and thorax dark greyish brown.
turn.10: Collar fringed with crimson and with a pair of pale-ringed black spots.
turn.12: Tegulae with two pairs and vertex of thorax with one similar spot.
